title: Notice of Removal of Lawyer for Party

pages.name: Notice of Removal of Lawyer for Party
pages.description:
If you have filed an Application About a Family Law Matter, reply or counter application with the court and you no longer want to have the court make a decision about it, you can file a Notice of Removal of Lawyer for Party to stop it from continuing before the court.

If an application, reply or counter application is discontinued, it means that it has been abandoned. The party or the court cannot take any further action on the application or counter application but it does not cancel anything that has already been done in court.

You can only discontinue your own application, reply or counter application. If the other party has their own application, reply or counter application, it is not affected. This means you may still have to go to court about their document. If the other party also wants to discontinue their application, reply or counter application, they must also complete a Notice of Removal of Lawyer for Party.

elements.name: ApplicantName
elements.title: What is your name?
elements.description: This is the name of the lawyer for the child. If you are filing out this form for a lawyer for the child, fill in their name.
elements.descFirstName: First Name is also known as Given Name
elements.descMiddleName: If you have more than one Middle Name, write them all in this box with spaces separating your Middle Names
elements.descLastName: Last Name is also known as Family Name or Surname

elements.name: OtherPartyInfoNlpr
elements.title: What is the full name of each party?
elements.description: Copy the name from any filed document. Add each party from your existing case.

elements.name: addressTitle
elements.title: address
elements.html: Please provide your address information
